title: AI Literacy (KS3)
summary: An introductory unit on what AI is and where students encounter it.
overview: This unit gives pupils a clear, accessible introduction to Artificial Intelligence in everyday contexts. It focuses on understanding what AI is, how it is used, and how to talk about it accurately.
learningFocus: Recognise common examples of AI in everyday life
Use accurate language when describing AI
Begin to consider the benefits and limitations of AI systems

lessons.title: AI Literacy Introduction
lessons.summary: Introduction to what AI is and where students encounter it.

title: Data Representation (KS3)
summary: A first step into how data is represented in digital systems.
overview: This unit introduces pupils to binary representation and builds a foundation for later learning about data and information.

lessons.title: Binary Basics
lessons.summary: Binary place values and converting binary to denary.

title: Digital Literacy (KS1)
summary: An early introduction to technology as human-designed tools.
overview: This unit helps pupils understand that technology is created by people to solve problems and help in everyday life.
learningFocus: Explain technology as tools designed by people

lessons.title: What is Technology? A Digital Literacy Foundation Lesson
lessons.summary: Introduce technology as tools people make to help them in everyday life.

title: Foundations of Digital Systems (KS3)
summary: A foundational unit introducing key digital literacy concepts and systems thinking.
overview: This unit introduces pupils to the core ideas that underpin modern digital literacy. It focuses on defining technology, distinguishing digital systems, and understanding how systems are structured.
learningFocus: Develop precise language for describing technology and digital systems
Understand how digital systems differ from non-digital systems
Apply systems thinking using inputs, processes and outputs
